Still current, varies by province. Some provinces, like Quebec, continue to restrict gathering size to maximum 10.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200924132126/https://www.quebec.ca/en/health/health-issues/a-z/2019-coronavirus/gatherings-events-covid19/
No change in policy found.

Still current, bans remain in place restricting travel to Canada.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200924132245/https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/coronavirus-covid19/travel-restrictions-exemptions.html

"More than 400 schools in Quebec and another 153 in Ontario are reporting at least one case of coronavirus disease."     http://web.archive.org/web/20200924132901/https://www.ctvnews.ca/health/coronavirus/coronavirus-hits-more-schools-amid-growing-fears-of-pandemic-s-second-wave-1.5116858

"Ontario will begin offering COVID-19 testing in pharmacies Friday, beginning with up to 60 pharmacies around the province, the premier says."; however, may be some delays with starting testing Friday    http://web.archive.org/web/20200924133040/https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/covid-19-coronavirus-ontario-september-23-fall-plan-part-2-1.5735266

Public events remain banned in most areas of the country, but some low-incidence areas in states do allow public events under certain circumstances (e.g. mask requirements, social distancing, maximum of attendees etc.). Other areas with rising numbers (see e.g. source from Sep 30 below) have seen all public events canceled.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201004124000/https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/public-health-restrictions-quebec-covid-19-1.5745046
Restrictions in some provinces/territories remain at the level 4, as previous, hence 4T is maintained.

A number of provinces require self-isolation on arrival for 14 days for inter-provincial travel, effectively restricting internal movment. For example, the Atlantic provinces form a "protective bubble" but require isolation for anyone outside this bubble. Similar provisions are in place in the Northwestern Territories and Nunavut. https://web.archive.org/web/20200923140549/https://gov.nu.ca/health/information/travel-and-isolation https://web.archive.org/web/20201004132600/https://novascotia.ca/coronavirus/travel/

Quebec closes all bars, casinos, museums, cinemas and theatres in "red zones" with high infection rates. Restaurants in those areas are also prohibited from providing dine-in services and can only offer takeout. https://web.archive.org/web/20201004124000/https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/public-health-restrictions-quebec-covid-19-1.5745046  are closed.

Advice on staying home and staying careful still in place. https://web.archive.org/web/20201001213156/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-infection/prevention-risks.html

Targeted closings remain in effect in several states according to the Edweek tracker. These include Hawaii, California, Oregon, New Mexico, and West Virginia. Some US territories (Washington DC, Puerto Rico) continue with full closures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200928032026/https://www.edweek.org/ew/section/multimedia/map-covid-19-schools-open-closed.html?s_kwcid=AL%216416%213%21455874877102%21b%21%21g%21%21school%2520closures&gclid=CjwKCAjw8MD7BRArEiwAGZsrBRfHqJRiG8pqlV9u1Fcw4A23jNB5VKo7BPMWpvm75kV5qbWYLn_G7RoC808QAvD_BwE

NYT tracker shows retail, restaurants, gyms and hair salons still closed in some states (ex: WA, NY, CA)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200926173926/https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/us/states-reopen-map-coronavirus.html
Some event venues are being reopened; however, events proceed at reduced capacity in several states (e.g. Pennsylvania).  https://web.archive.org/web/20200928032339if_/https://www.washingtonpost.com/

There do not appear to be any regions of the country that continue to enforce a gathering limit of under 10 people. Some states, such as Kansas, enforce a limit of 15, with others limiting at 25.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200928032339if_/https://www.washingtonpost.com/
Public transit systems throughout the country are open but often operate with restrictions.
No evidence of stay-at-home requirements in effect. Recommendations continue to advise limiting movements.

States like New York continue to require visitors from other states with high caseloads to quarantine upon arrival.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200926214403/https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/covid-19-travel-advisory
The United States continues to prevent arrivals from certain countries. https://web.archive.org/web/20200928033806/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/from-other-countries.html

Per the previous coding, CARES funding is expiring in many sectors.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200928035352/https://thehill.com/policy/finance/518370-households-businesses-fall-into-financial-holes-as-covid-aid-dries-up  Its replacement, a $300-400 unemployment benefits cheque under the "Lost Wages Assistance" program, continues to be disbursed in some states, as per one tracker.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200926111345/https://www.unemploymentpua.com/articles/lwatracker.html
Student loan reprieve continues.

According to the latest data from Edweek's tracker, some US states (inducing Hawaii, California, and West Virginia) mandate school closures in some parts of their states due to the risk of infection. Some US territories (Washington DC, Puerto Rico) continue with full closures.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201012153605/https://www.edweek.org/ew/section/multimedia/map-covid-19-schools-open-closed.html?s_kwcid=AL%216416%213%21455874877102%21b%21%21g%21%21school%2520reopenings&gclid=CjwKCAjw_Y_8BRBiEiwA5MCBJqHWkbJBI7eGWbK2BUc3j4GKdCSsH3ujH3K94aqqu5SKIRY-UPGcXhoClZIQAvD_BwE

NYT tracker shows substantial reopening since last note. Nevertheless, some businesses, particularly bars, remain closed in certain states (ex: TX, MI, CA)  https://web.archive.org/web/20201011144839/https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/us/states-reopen-map-coronavirus.html

Some jurisdictions (e.g. some areas of California) require events to be cancelled if criteria on cases are not met. Most states require events to proceed with distancing and other sanitary precautions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200925082257/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases

Hawaii appears to have the strictest gathering limits in the nation, with gatherings of over 10 people not permitted. Some other states, like Connecticut, limit gatherings of over 25.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201012154301/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
Public transit systems throughout the country are open but often operate with restrictions.
No evidence of stay-at-home requirements in effect. Recommendations (e.g. in Arizona) continue to advise limiting movements.

States like New York continue to require visitors from other states with high caseloads to quarantine upon arrival. At latest count, 35 other states are on New York's quarantine list.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201011231808/https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/covid-19-travel-advisory
The United States continues to prevent arrivals from certain countries. https://web.archive.org/web/20201012074646/https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/from-other-countries.html

The Department of Labor continues to maintain that states are now authorized to disburse unemployment insurance under the CARES act. Nevertheless there does not appear to be evidence of disbursals, most funding having been depleted.
Student loan deferral continues.
The CDC continues to run a coordinated public campaign.
In some states (such as Arizona), testing is generally available.
In some states (such as Arizona), contact tracing continues on a comprehensive basis.
